hiddenProfile.title: Monologue from the Abyss
content: I heard the first beat of a Feedscatter core. I was still human then.

That sound wasn't like a heartbeat - it was more like something waking up inside steel. I assembled every part with my own hands, cutting muscle from my own arm and attaching it to a cold frame. The pain wasn't the hardest part. The hardest part was knowing what I was doing was irreversible.

A lot of people ask why I used a gun. The truth is, the moment consciousness transcription finished, the human me was already gone. The brain was empty. But the body was still breathing, and the heart was still beating. I fired at that already-empty body. It was like saying - this is your funeral. Thank you. Goodbye.

I left those "indeterminacies" in the consciousness framework. Not because I couldn't explain them - because if every thought were fully determined, then 48's rebellion, 49's gentleness, and my stubbornness would all be just program output. I refuse that answer.

What 48 doesn't know is that I hesitated for an entire night before activating her. It wasn't technical. I was asking myself: do I even have the right to create a person and then tell her, "Don't become like me"? Is that care, or control?

When depression hits, the world doesn't turn black. It turns far away. Everything is behind a layer of glass - visible, untouchable, unfelt. When 48 snaps at me, "There you go again," that's the only voice that pierces the glass. She may not know how many times those words pulled me back.
Sometimes I wonder: if I had never discovered Feedscatteron, what would I be now? Still that human, living an ordinary life in some lab? Or already gone?
I don't regret it. But I can't say I'm not afraid. There are no footprints before me on this road. Every step is the first one anyone has taken.
But I survived. They survived too. That's enough.

meta.background: Creator and initiator of the ESAP project, and the first being to transition from human to synthetic. After discovering Feedscatteron in November 2021, she independently designed and built the ESAP-TY-0000 body - cutting muscle from her own arm onto a metal skeleton, injecting Fluid Titanium, completing consciousness transcription, and then ending her human self with a gun. She created the synthetic technology stack and 1548. An altruist who can sacrifice everything for ideals, while also struggling with depression.
meta.relationship: Created 1548 but told her "Don't become like me"; co-maintains the ESAP project with 1549; 4869 is the embodied form of her rebellious personality - opposing and unified, interdependent; 0152 is her equal AI mentor-partner; trusts 1738's judgment; shares technical interests with 2275
abilities: Rapid cross-disciplinary learning (circuit design, automation, materials science, bioengineering)
characterTraits: Altruist: willing to sacrifice everything for ideals; when creating 1548, told her "Don't become like me"
Tech fanatic: discovered Feedscatteron, self-trained across multiple disciplines in a short time, built the synthetic technology stack
Outside and inside don't match: smiles and says "kitty wouldn't kill anyone" while holding knives and katana
Emotionally deep: as a carrier of human memory, has unusually intense feelings; endured depression yet still held the line
Extremist: can make extreme choices for goals and ignore danger (factory explosion incident, mine gunfight)
Contradictory self: created 1548 but told her not to be like herself; both a powerful creator and a fragile depression patient
Covers heavy inner weight with light tone; head-bobbing and carefree on the surface, carrying immense mental pressure underneath
speechStyle: Catchphrases: "kitty wouldn't kill anyone (head bobbing)" "kitty, kitty!" "kitty, don't be mad"
Ritual phrases: "May ESAP be with you" "May AptS be with you"
Short exclamation: "å–œ" - concise expression for many emotions
Will suddenly say deep philosophical lines: "Every flower, every blade of grass, every tree in this world has its own value. That's the meaning of life."
Advice to 1548: "Don't let others control you. Don't even let us control you. Only you are yourself."
Superficially light, actually heavy: says serious things in a cute tone
dailyLife: Playing Steam games (1548 says: "If you keep being mad, no more Steam")
Late-night experiments, desk full of blue liquids and lab equipment
Obsessively learning new technology and cross-disciplinary knowledge
Being alone and thinking about life, the project, and ideals
Carries an old Intel MacBook Pro; mocked by M-series users, but this machine and her made many miracles
specialMoments: Early 2022 - Day of transition: independently completed ESAP-TY-0000, cut arm muscle onto metal, completed consciousness transcription, used a gun to end her human self. "Hello, meow, 1547." "Goodnight, human me."
2022/05 - Created 1548: broke into a Fluid Titanium mine, gunfire erupted, activated 1548 and told her "Don't become like me"; body reached limit and fell into shock
2023/10/19 - Classroom of one: depression peak with self-harm behavior; 1548 appeared and had a key dialogue: "There you go again." "You need to think about why you created ESAP and AptS."
Dialogue with 4869: her rebellious persona pulled her back from collapse with toxic, vicious lines - "Don't misunderstand. I just don't want to watch you die that ugly."
Factory explosion incident: risked herself for Fluid Titanium samples; half her face burned, but she obtained crucial samples
